title: 100 False Claims in First 100 Days of Second Term
summary: CNN fact-checked 100 false claims in Trump's first 100 days of second term alone. Includes lies about bacon prices 'quadrupling' (19-21%), grocery prices being 'down' (actually up 2.7%), and mathematically impossible drug price cuts of '900%.'
keyFacts: CNN fact-checked 100 false claims in first 100 days - and that was not comprehensive
Falsely claimed bacon prices 'quadrupled' under Biden (actual increase: ~19-21%)
Falsely claimed apple prices 'doubled' under Biden (actual increase: ~7-8%)
Falsely claimed 'grocery prices are down' (up 2.7% year-over-year)
Claimed he 'won youth by 36 points' - Harris actually won voters ages 18-24, 25-29, and 30-39
Claimed drug prices would be cut '200%, 300%, 400%... 900%' - mathematically impossible
Joint address to Congress (March 2025): Fact-checkers identified 12+ separate lies
December 2025: 150+ Truth Social posts between 9pm-midnight including conspiracy theories

sources.text: CNN: Fact check: Debunking 100 Trump false claims from his first 100 days
PolitiFact: 100 PolitiFact fact-checks from President Donald Trump's first 100 days
Wikipedia: False or misleading statements by Donald Trump (second term)
